product_name: NYX Professional MakeupLimited Edition Wednesday Mystery PH Lip Oil
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeGive BackDrip your lips in NYX Professional Makeup Wednesday Mystery PH Lip Oil . FAT perks. FAT shine. FAT Protection. FAT Hydration. Now in 3 color-shifting shades.
details: DetailsFeaturesColor-shifting Lip Oil? Groundbreaking... Prepare to transform your lips with the Wednesday Mystery PH Lip Oil, packed with anything but basic benefits.This lip oil is overflowing with FAT care, long-lasting shine, and a non-sticky texture.And the best part their FAT applicator. This generously sized applicator hugs your lips, ensuring even application every time.NYX Professional Makeup is bringing you three brand-new color-shifting shades, each one as mysterious and mesmerizing as Wednesday herself. So, yeah, you might even crack a smile. But let's not get carried away.Vegan Formula. No animal-derived ingredients. Cruelty-free. Obviously...Item 2645332How To UseDesigned with a FAT applicator that hugs your lips for precise application every time. You're just a swipe away from FAT perks. Groundbreaking...IngredientsPolyisobutene, Tridecyl Trimellitate, Paraffinum Liquidum / Mineral Oil / Huile Minerale, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Diisostearyl Malate, Isononyl Isononanoate, Polyglyceryl-3 Diisostearate, Rosa Canina Fruit Oil, Rubus Chamaemorus Seed Oil, Rubus Idaeus Seed Oil / Raspberry Seed Oil, Tin Oxide, Squalane, Aroma / Flavor, Aluminum Hydroxide, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Dibutyl Ethylhexanoyl Glutamide, Ethylhexylglycerin, Tocopherol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Diethylhexyl Syringylidenemalonate, Sorbic Acid, Phenoxyethanol, CI 15850 / Red 7 Lake, Ci 45410 / Red 27, CI 77491 / Iron Oxides, CI 77492 / Iron Oxides, CI 77499 / Iron Oxides, CI 77891 / Titanium Dioxide, Benzyl Alcohol (F.I.L. N70044478/2).
how_to_use: Designed with a FAT applicator that hugs your lips for precise application every time. You're just a swipe away from FAT perks. Groundbreaking...
ingredients: Paraffinum Liquidum / Mineral Oil / Huile Minerale
Rubus Idaeus Seed Oil / Raspberry Seed Oil

reviews.headline: Good feel
reviews.comments: The formula is nice and thick but goes on smooth. Good coverage with only a few strokes.  The formula doesn't feel sticky after applying. Can't speak to how long it lasts as I tend to lick my lips and remove it quickly.

reviews.headline: Wednesday
reviews.comments: Got it for my daughter & she loves it.

reviews.headline: Nice lip oil
reviews.comments: Bought it in the color Nightshad. Its a pretty very sheer black color.

reviews.headline: Thorn Pricked - Love It
reviews.comments: Smells good, looks good, tastes good. Does not stick or burn. Beautiful light rosy red color, just enough to make your lips look sexy and inviting. I may need a backup.

reviews.headline: Excellent color
reviews.comments: Nightshade color purchased.  Not one for trendy products, but love Wednesday and wanted to try something new.  Great color after applying.  This is not a "one and done" product try for me. I will use and possibly repurchase.

reviews.headline: Adjusts to a beautiful color
reviews.comments: I bought this on a whim because i usually dont wear lip gloss due to it coming off so quickly. I was pleasantly surprised! The night shade adjust to a beautiful plum berry shade with cool purple undertones. The color lasts a few hours and my lips were very hydrated and soft when it wore off.

reviews.headline: Misleading
reviews.comments: I know that ph adjusting products don't actually adjust to your ph but i got the shade nightshade and its not like the pictures. It seems as though it was going to be a berry shade, wasn't expecting it to be black or anything. Its essentially one of those hot pink "ph adjusting" lip products with black pigment. It's patchy and once it wipes off ur left with pink lips. Beware if thats not what u want. Im not sensitive to smell but it also smelled like sweet nail polish

reviews.headline: Favorite pop culture collab
reviews.comments:
I am obsessed with this! Absolutely stunning and the subtly gothic tint of my dreams. 

I purchased the color Nightshade and it is such a brilliant and well executed limited edition lip oil. The color appears as a gorgeous muted mauvy shade, which is created by the interplay of the berry colored tint it imparts through the translucently black gloss formula; they really nailed Wednesday's lip color in the show in such a fun way. Initially you get this effect where you can see the lightly black tone, which I loved, and the longer you wear it the more it transforms into the berry shade.

Another big pro - It's a light enough tint that shows the color without the patchiness that I tend to experience from most pH lip tints.

It's just what I've been looking for and I plan to stock up on more of this beautifully unique shade, because I'll be wearing it all spooky season!

reviews.headline: Night Shade
reviews.comments: Loved the Wednesday collection, the lip oil is cute and leaves a burgundy-ish color. The packaging is cute with THING on the lid. Would recommend!

reviews.headline: looks great on light skin! Little goes long way
cute packaging but also good gloss
reviews.comments: I love the packaging but I actually love the product, too! I'm not a huge gloss fan (I like matte and/or long wear shine formulas more) but this one is great. I love the shade as it slightly darkens and cools my lip tone but it's also very comfortable, not sticky, and there's no feathering (i hate glosses that bleed). Overall  if you want the cute packaging, or just a fun shade of gloss, this one is good.

reviews.headline: Love These!
reviews.comments: I purchased all 3 colors and I love all of them!  I would say they are more like lipgloss than lip oil.  Nightshade is a deep purple (which you can tell from the pictures) and it adjusts to a beautiful color.  They all do, actually!  I have sensitive skin and lips and I have no problem wearing these.  The smell is not overpowering and it fades quickly.  Definitely recommend!

reviews.headline: so sick of PH products....
reviews.comments: ...but this black lip oil is really gorg. i was really bummed when i first saw that a black lip oil from nyx was just anither PH adaptive product, but the way the dark pigment mixes with the pink makes a reallt reslly gorgeous color. not sure if i will try the other shades but i recomend the black one if you like the nyx lip oil formula and was a gorg vampy option

reviews.headline: Disappointing
reviews.comments: I bought the Nightshade oil and while I do think the color looks nice after the pH adjusts, there's just this unpleasant smell I can't seem to get over. I had a couple friends smell it as well and one quote said "It smells like when you walk into a Spirit Halloween," and I honestly can't think of a better description. I love the packaging, and I do like the color after it adjusts, but it does look patchy after application. Just wish it would apply a little more evenly, and the smell wasn't so unpleasant.

reviews.headline: Nice color changing formula!
reviews.comments: I love the color changing lip gloss! It leaves lips moisturized and the color is beautiful. The only con is that lips feel a bit dry after wearing it. But, that's with all lip glosses. The packaging is cute with "Thing" on top.

reviews.headline: Disappointing :/
reviews.comments: If youre picking these up because you love the fat oil formula, it is not the same formula. These are more like a true lip oil formula with a staining element. Nightshade is not black, its a plum and Moonshifted is a sheer, softly bitten shade. They are not as comfortable nourishing and long lasting like the normal formula. The packing is adorable but nyx cheaped out for this collection. I usually love their limited editions

rollup.name: Limited Edition Wednesday Mystery PH Lip Oil
